fake.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a copy of a valuable object, painting etc that is intended to deceive people
fake.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: The painting was judged a fake.
Jones can spot a fake from 20 feet away.
fake.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: someone who is not what they claim to be or does not have the skills they say they have
fake.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: Her psychologist turned out to be a fake.
fake.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: made to look like a real material or object in order to deceive people
fake.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: not real and seeming to be something it is not, in order to deceive people
fake.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: She was speaking with a fake German accent.
fake.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: to make something seem real in order to deceive people
fake.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: She faked her father’s signature on the cheque.
The insurance company suspected that he had faked his own death.
The results of the experiments were faked.
fake.translation[2].definitions[1].defin: to pretend to be ill, interested etc when you are not
fake.translation[2].definitions[1].examp: I thought he was really hurt but he was faking it.
fake.translation[2].definitions[2].defin: to pretend to move in one direction, but then move in another, especially when playing sport
fake.translation[3].definitions[0].defin: made to look like something valuable or GENUINE (=real) in order to deceive people
fake.translation[3].definitions[0].examp: Three bank employees had issued fake certificates for collateral on loans.
fake.translation[4].definitions[0].defin: a copy of an original document, valuable object etc that is intended to deceive people into believing it is the real document, object etc
fake.translation[4].definitions[0].examp: The signature on the contract proved to be a fake.
fake.translation[5].definitions[0].defin: to make an exact copy of something, or invent figures or results, in order to deceive people
fake.translation[5].definitions[0].examp: She had faked her boss’s signature on the cheque.
